entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued September 12 at 5:12PM MST until September 12 at 5:45PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR SOUTHWESTERN PINAL COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 515 PM MST... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However small hail, gusty winds and heavy rain are still possible with this

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 5:09PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Pima County through 600 PM MST... At 509 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pascua Pueblo Yaqui Reservation, or 10 miles southwest of Tucson, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Tucson Metro Area including Tucson, Green Valley, Marana, Vail

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 4:47PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Pinal County through 530 PM MST... At 447 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Arizona City, or 14 miles south of Casa Grande, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued September 12 at 4:46PM MST until September 12 at 6:45PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL MOHAVE COUNTY... At 446 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain moved north of prior to 415 PM. Between 1 and 1.75 inches of rain fell over the area between Chloride and Golden Valley. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
